8268a9b9-58f9-4d71-a8ff-09eddbc187b3.description: This examination is comprised of a three hour, 210-item computer-administrated examination covering the scope of practice of an ophthalmic assistant. Allied Ophthalmic Personnel seeking certification at the COA level are required to meet one of the prerequisites outlined above to apply to sit for the examination.
8268a9b9-58f9-4d71-a8ff-09eddbc187b3.name: Certified Ophthalmic Assistant (COA) Examination v3

issuer.summary: issued by Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

entity.name: Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

badge_template_activities.title: The skills and/or knowledge measured include history taking, pupillary assessment, contact lenses, equipment maintenance and repair, lensometry, keratometry, medical ethics, legal, and regulatory issues, microbiology, pharmacology, ocular motility, assisting in surgical procedures, ophthalmic patient services and education, ophthalmic imaging, refractometry, spectacle skills, supplemental skills, tonometry, visual assessment, and visual fields.

Prerequisite: Graduate of a formal ophthalmic clinical assistant education training program approved by International Council of Accreditation (ICA); graduate of a formal training program and at least 500 hours of work experience under the supervision of an ophthalmologist; or completion of an independent study course and at least 1,000 hours of work experience.

31352291-1e54-4c65-bb16-0fefd23f92c7.description: This examination is comprised of a three hour, 200-item computer-administered multiple-choice examination covering the scope of practice of an ophthalmic assistant.
31352291-1e54-4c65-bb16-0fefd23f92c7.name: Certified Ophthalmic Assistant (COA) Examination v2

issuer.summary: issued by Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

entity.name: Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

badge_template_activities.title: The skills measured include history taking, pupillary assessment, contact lenses, equipment maintenance and repair, lensometry, keratometry, medical ethics, legal and regulatory issues, microbiology, pharmacology, ocular motility, assisting in surgical procedures, ophthalmic patient services and education, ophthalmic imaging, refractometry, spectacle skills, supplemental skills, tonometry, visual assessment, and visual fields.

4d69488f-caf9-4031-a61b-fa5328f06482.description: A three and one half hour, 210-item computer-administered examination covering the scope of practice of an ophthalmic assistant. Ophthalmic allied health professionals seeking certification at the COA level must meet exam eligibility requirements. JCAHPO administers the COA exam on a computer, and does not require a hands-on test at this level. This examination assesses knowledge in six content areas.
4d69488f-caf9-4031-a61b-fa5328f06482.name: Certified Ophthalmic Assistant (COA) Examination v1

issuer.summary: issued by Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

entity.name: Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

badge_template_activities.title: Knowledge Measured: 17% Basic Skills and Lensometry; 15% Basic Tonometry; 21% General Medical Knowledge; 20% History Taking; 11% Instrument Maintenance; 16% Patient Services

3826fa24-6d00-4fa9-8f6e-17b11bc2d6b9.description: This examination is comprised of a three hour, 200-item examination that covers the scope of practice of an ophthalmic technician. Candidates must also pass a computer-simulated skill evaluation in seven areas. Two hours are allotted to complete the skill evaluation.
3826fa24-6d00-4fa9-8f6e-17b11bc2d6b9.name: Certified Ophthalmic Technician (COT) Examination v3

issuer.summary: issued by Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

entity.name: Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

badge_template_activities.title: The skills and/or knowledge measured include history taking, pupillary assessment, contact lenses, equipment maintenance and repair, lensometry, keratometry, medical ethics, legal, and regulatory issues, microbiology, Pharmacology, ocular motility, assisting in surgical procedures, ophthalmic patient services and education, ophthalmic imaging, refractometry, spectacle skills, supplemental skills, tonometry, visual assessment, and visual fields.

This examination requires candidates to demonstrate the following abilities: non-automated lensometry; perform an automated visual field; detect a phoria or tropia; perform keratometry; perform retinoscopy; perform refinement; and perform applanation tonometry.  Allied Ophthalmic Personnel seeking certificate at the COT level must meet examination eligibility requirements.

c39a4749-74fa-44d2-9d4f-f4469cbf9303.description: This examination is comprised of a three hour, 160-item computer administered examination that covers the scope of practice of an ophthalmic technician. Candidates must also pass a computer-simulated skill evaluation in five areas. Allied Ophthalmic Personnel seeking certificate at the COMT level must meet examination eligibility requirements.
c39a4749-74fa-44d2-9d4f-f4469cbf9303.name: Certified Ophthalmic Medical Technologist (COMT) Examination v3

issuer.summary: issued by Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

entity.name: Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

badge_template_activities.title: The skills and/or knowledge measured include history taking, pupillary assessment, equipment maintenance and repair, lensometry, keratometry, medical ethics, legal, and regulatory issues, microbiology, Pharmacology, ocular motility, assisting in surgical procedures, ophthalmic patient services and education, ophthalmic imaging, refractometry, supplemental skills, tonometry, visual assessment, and visual fields.

This examination requires candidates to demonstrate the following abilities: measure patient's ocular motility using prism and cover test at a distance; perform manual lensometry: identify and measure prism; perform fundus photography and identify fluorescein angiography phases; measure, compare, and evaluate pupil function at a distance; and evaluate versions and ductions, identifying any abnormalities.

330c9c9e-efa8-451c-b18d-914446043191.description: A three and one half hour, 210-item computer-administered examination covering 13 content areas which define the scope of practice of an ophthalmic technician. Additionally, candidates are required to pass a hands-on skills evaluation in which skills across six areas are evaluated simultaneously by two ophthalmic professionals currently practicing in the field. Ophthalmic allied health professionals seeking certification at the COT level must meet exam eligibility requirements.
330c9c9e-efa8-451c-b18d-914446043191.name: Certified Ophthalmic Technician (COT) Examination v1

issuer.summary: issued by Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

entity.name: Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

badge_template_activities.title:
Knowledge Measured: 10% Basic Ocular Motility; 8% Basic Skills and Lensometry; 4% Basic Tonometry; 14% Clinical Optics; 10% Contact Lenses; 10% General Medical Knowledge; 7% History Taking; 6% Instrument Maintenance; 4% Intermediate Tonometry; 8% Ocular Pharmacology; 4% Patient Services; 3% Photography; 12% Visual Fields.
Skills Measured: Clinical Optics, Ocular Motility, Visual Fields, Contact Lens, Tonometry.

bbe2586f-f337-4435-bc3b-10e9c72045d5.description: The examination is comprised of a three hour, 200-item multiple-choice examination covering 19 content areas that define the scope of practice of an ophthalmic technician. The 19 content areas contain the cumulative content areas of the Certified Ophthalmic Assistant (COA) examination. Candidates must also pass a computer-simulated skill evaluation.
bbe2586f-f337-4435-bc3b-10e9c72045d5.name: Certified Ophthalmic Technician (COT) Examination v2

issuer.summary: issued by Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

1f43f791-6467-49ed-8680-ef57d6a8f981.description: This 3-hour, 200 item computer administrated covers the scope of practice of an ophthalmic assistant. Allied Ophthalmic Personnel seeking certification at the COA level are required to meet one of the prerequisites outlined above to apply to sit for the examination. This exam is being recommended for a total of 12 semester hours in the lower-division
1f43f791-6467-49ed-8680-ef57d6a8f981.name: Certified Ophthalmic Assistant (COA) Examination(v.4)

entity.name: Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

badge_template_activities.title: The skills measured include History and Documentation; Visual Assessment; Visual Field Testing; Pupil Assessment; Tonometry; Keratometry; Ocular Motility Testing; Lensometry; Refraction, Retinoscopy and Refinement; Biometry; Supplemental Testing; Microbiology; Pharmacology; Surgical Assisting; Ophthalmic Patient Services and Education; Optics and Spectacles; Contact Lenses; Ophthalmic Imaging; Photography and Videography; Equipment Maintenance and Repair; Medical Ethics, Legal and Regulatory

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 12 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

bd387451-c516-440b-9235-f78ed30d1881.description: The COMT examination consists of a computer examination and hands-on Performance Test. The COMT examination addresses knowledge in 23 content areas and consists of 210 items. Only candidates who successfully complete the COMT computer examination may take the hands-on Performance Test. The Performance Test addresses skills in: Advanced Tonometry; Clinical Optics (I, II, III); Ocular Motility (I, II); Photography; Pupil Assessment; Special Instruments and Techniques; and Visual Fields.
bd387451-c516-440b-9235-f78ed30d1881.name: Certified Ophthalmic Medical Technologist (COMT) Examination v1

issuer.summary: issued by Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

entity.name: Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

badge_template_activities.title: Knowledge Measured: 2% Advance Color Vision; 18% Clinical Optics; 6% Advanced General Medical Knowledge; 7% Advanced Ocular Motility; 6% Photography; 5% Advanced Pharmacology; 7% Tonometry; 11% Visual Fields; 5% Basic Ocular Motility; 2% Basic Skills and Lensometry; 8% Contact Lenses; 3% General Medical Knowledge; 1% History Taking; 2% Instrument Maintenance; 2% Microbiology; 6% Ocular Pharmacology; 1% Patient Services; 8% Special Instruments and Techniques.
Skills Measured (Skill Evaluation Examination by Content Area): Clinical Optics, Ocular Motility, Photography, Special Instruments and Techniques, and Visual Fields.

ff4c9590-b9ca-48f8-a963-a5ff7b47d79c.description: The examination is comprised of a three hour, 160 item multiple-choice examination covering 17 content areas that define the scope of practice of an ophthalmic medical technologist and the Certified Ophthalmic Assistant (COA) and Certified Ophthalmic Technician (COT) examinations. Candidates must also pass a computer-simulated performance test.
ff4c9590-b9ca-48f8-a963-a5ff7b47d79c.name: Certified Ophthalmic Medical Technologist (COMT) Examination v2

issuer.summary: issued by Joint Commission on Allied Health Personnel in Ophthalmology

badge_template_activities.title: The skills measured include history taking, pupillary assessment, equipment maintenance and repair, lensometry, keratometry, medical ethics, legal and regulatory issues, microbiology, Pharmacology, ocular motility, assisting in surgical procedures, ophthalmic patient services and education, ophthalmic imaging, refractometry, supplemental skills, tonometry, visual assessment, and visual fields.

6c91649c-e1a6-49ae-9a99-776d5bb8ee31.description: This 3-hour, 190 item computer administrated covers the scope of practice of an ophthalmic technician. Candidates must also pass a computer-simulated skill evaluation in five areas. One hour is allotted to complete the Performance Test. This exam is recommended for a total of 15 semester hours in the upper-division
6c91649c-e1a6-49ae-9a99-776d5bb8ee31.name: Certified Ophthalmic Medical Technologist (COMT) Examination(v.4)

badge_template_activities.title: The skills measured include History and Documentation; Visual Assessment; Visual Field Testing; Pupil Assessment; Tonometry; Keratometry; Ocular Motility Testing; Lensometry; Refraction, Retinoscopy and Refinement; Biometry; Supplemental Testing; Microbiology; Pharmacology; Surgical Assisting; Ophthalmic Patient Services and Education; Optics and Spectacles; Contact Lenses; Ophthalmic Imaging; Photography and Videography; Equipment Maintenance and Repair; Medical Ethics, Legal and Regulatory

COMT Performance Test Skill Areas: Measure patient’s ocular motility using prism and cover test at a distance. Perform manual lensometry: Identify and measure prism. Perform fundus photography and identify fluorescein angiography phases. Measure, compare, and evaluate pupil function at a distance. Evaluate versions and ductions, identifying any abnormalities. There is no time limit on each of the individual tasks.
